Hero.title: Do you want to work in Europe?
Hero.text: If you are from Latin America, from countries such as Argentina, Colombia, Costa Rica, Chile, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Mexico, Uruguay, or Venezuela, we are interested in offering you work in the construction sector. If you meet our requirements, we invite you to check the requirements section on our website. Then, you can explore what we offer in the “conditions” tab. If you are ready, start the process and follow the indicated steps.

AboutSectionOne.title: About us
AboutSectionOne.1: Our company is headquartered in the city of Lodz, located in central Poland. We specialize in the construction sector, and we are proud to offer professional services with more than 20 years of experience. During this time, we have established a solid network of contacts and acquired the necessary wisdom to carry out projects efficiently and effectively from the beginning.
AboutSectionOne.2: Our commitment to legality is fundamental. We offer legal employment and provide legal advice to our employees. Additionally, for those who join our team, we offer accommodation and food options, which guarantees a comfortable and favorable environment to work.
AboutSectionOne.3: Right now, we are focused on expanding to German and Italian market. We believe that our experience and dedication will allow us to establish ourselves successfully in these countries and provide exceptional service to our customers.

AboutSectionTwo.text1: All our job offers are made under a legal contract and based on the law.
AboutSectionTwo.text2: All the conditions of our job offers are clearly detailed and explained.
AboutSectionTwo.text3: We will be there to guide you and accompany you every step of the way.

Testimonial.title: Opinions of Our Clients
Testimonial.op1: At first I thought it was a lie but I needed to try because I couldn't get a job. I thank God for having tried since today I am working in Poland.
Testimonial.op2: I sent the information requested in the registration and in a very short time I was working in Poland.
Testimonial.op3: Thank you very much for the job opportunity, I have had a good experience working in the team.

Proceso.title: Work process
Proceso.subtitle: What can you do to work with us?
Proceso.text1: Our process is simple and transparent. As a reliable and professional company, we strictly comply with the law and hire legally.
Proceso.text2: You may already know that, if you are from countries like Argentina, Colombia, Costa Rica, Chile, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Mexico, Uruguay, or Venezuela you can enter the Schengen zone as a tourist with your passport, with a maximum stay of 90 days. Citizens of Bolivia, Ecuador or Cuba needs a visa to enter. The Schengen zone includes all countries of the European Union, except Ireland, the United Kingdom and Cyprus. Countries such as Albania, Belarus, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Macedonia, Moldova, Russia, Serbia, Ukraine, and Turkey do not belong to the European Union.
Proceso.text3: What would the steps be like:
Proceso.paso5: 5. Transition to a residence permit called here(karta pobytu)
Proceso.text4: Before starting the process, make sure you meet the specific requirements that our company establishes. You can find more details in the “Conditions” tab on our website.
Proceso.text5: Once you have verified that you meet the requirements, we will take care of obtaining the “work permit” on your behalf.
Proceso.text51: This permit can be granted for a maximum period of 3 years. We will process it while you are in your country of origin.
Proceso.text52: Once you have a work permit, you can travel to Poland and, the next day, take medical exams, sign the contract, and start working.
Proceso.text6: It is important to distinguish between the “work permit” and the “residence permit” called here (karta pobytu).
Proceso.text61: Although the work permit may be valid for 3 years, legally you can only stay in the Schengen zone (in this case Poland) for 90 days as a tourist.
Proceso.text62: Therefore, even if you have a long-term work permit, you must ensure that you comply with the regulations for staying in the Schengen zone.
Proceso.text7: The process to obtain a work permit is carried out when you are in your country of origin.
Proceso.text71: Arriving in Poland the next day, medical examinations are carried out and the contract is signed to start work.
Proceso.text72: Before completing 90 days, you return to the country of origin in case you do not have or do not want to apply for a residence permit.
Proceso.text8: If you want to work more than 90 days and stay with our company, we will evaluate your performance after the first month.
Proceso.text81: With a positive evaluation, we will help you obtain a residence permit (karta pobytu).
Proceso.text82: There are two types: a temporary one for 3 years and a normal one for 10 years.
Proceso.text83: The obtaining process lasts approximately 30 days.
Proceso.text9: Once granted, the residence permit is valid for 3 or 10 years.
Proceso.text91: With the residence permit, you no longer need a work permit to work in Poland.

Conditions.title: Our Work Conditions
Conditions.text1: At [Your Company Name], we are committed to ensuring a comfortable and supportive work environment for all our employees.
Conditions.text2: Below are the key conditions and benefits we offer:
Conditions.text4: We provide quality accommodation at a cost of 500-600 zł per month, depending on the location and available options.
Conditions.text5: The cost of food will vary based on your selected meal option. We offer guidance to help you choose the most suitable plan.
Conditions.text6: All necessary medical examinations required for work will be arranged and covered by the company, ensuring your readiness for the job.
Conditions.text7: The net hourly wage is 22 zł. For full-time employment (40 hours per week), this amounts to approximately 3,262 zł net per month.
Conditions.text8: Our standard work schedule is from Monday to Friday, 40 hours per week. Extra hours may be available and are compensated accordingly. While we typically do not work on weekends, there may occasionally be additional work on Saturdays, which will also be paid.
Conditions.text10: If you have any additional questions regarding the work conditions, feel free to contact us. We're here to support you every step of the way!

Contact.title: Contact Us
Contact.description: At [Your Company Name], we value open communication and are here to assist you. You can reach us through the following methods:
Contact.emailtext: For general inquiries, please email us. We strive to respond promptly.
Contact.whatsapptext: For urgent matters, feel free to contact us via WhatsApp. We aim to address urgent inquiries quickly.
Contact.formtext: To start your job application, please fill out our Job Application Form. We will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.
Contact.footer: We look forward to hearing from you!
